document_info.title: DMT Extraction Overview - A Concordance of Teks
document_info.purpose: NOT a tek itself, but a concordance/comparison of all extraction methods
document_info.key_insight: All DMT extractions follow the same basic process - they differ only in whether initial extract is acidified and what purification techniques they prefer
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry research.

universal_process: 1. Extract DMT into an aqueous solution
2. Collect DMT as freebase in nonpolar solvent
3. Recover the freebase as a solid
fundamental_principle.key_statement: All differences between teks are just differences in purification techniques

for_mimosa_hostilis.modification: Instead of ammonia wash of final product, use sodium carbonate wash from Vovin's tek (Step 7, pg 12)
for_mimosa_hostilis.caveat: A desire for simple answers may not serve you so well in your encounters with the spice

starting_materials.mimosa_advantage: Many report surprisingly pure product with minimal purification
starting_materials.acacia_note: Good option but ensure at least one acid-base process in procedure
starting_materials.other_materials: Consider fat content - include more optional purification steps
starting_materials.reference: See 'DMT is Everywhere' chapter of TiHKAL for full list

acid_base_extraction.process: Heat plant material in water acidified to pH 2-4
acid_base_extraction.recommended_for: Any plant material OTHER than Mimosa
acid_base_extraction.reason: Lends itself to more thorough purification

straight_to_base.process: Cover root bark with water basified to pH ~13 and pulverize
straight_to_base.result: Aqueous solution where DMT freebase is not very soluble
straight_to_base.mechanism: Excess hydroxide physically breaks down bark, exposes DMT to nonpolar solvent
straight_to_base.reason: Low total extraction time (Lazy Man's Tek etc.)
straight_to_base.warning: Basic polar wash on nonpolar solvent practically a MUST - otherwise residual lye makes product harsh
straight_to_base.us_legal_note: NaOH is watched chemical due to meth production - ordering online/credit card could have consequences

optional_first_defat.process: Extract acidic solution with couple volumes of nonpolar solvent, discard solvent
optional_first_defat.purpose: Remove unwanted plant fats and impurities

step_2_nonpolar_extraction.purpose: Recover DMT freebase into nonpolar solvent

not_recommended.xylene: Carries red pigment from Mimosa into final product
not_recommended.toluene: Carries red pigment from Mimosa into final product
not_recommended.note: Some people INTENTIONALLY use these to extract the psychoactive red pigment

step_2_nonpolar_extraction.technique_warning: SWIRL or GENTLY MIX layers - do NOT shake. Nasty emulsions form and must be avoided at all costs

for_acid_base_extractors.process: Deprotonate DMT back to freebase by adjusting to pH >~9.5
steps: Reduce volume of acidic solution if necessary
Extract with several volumes of nonpolar solvent
Discard basic solution (now stripped of DMT)

ph_debate.mimosa: Much higher pH necessary - due to phytochemical solutes affecting aqueous phase polarity
ph_debate.theory: Excess salt added before defatting might accomplish same as excess hydroxide - not yet confirmed successful

for_straight_to_base_extractors.process: Solution already basic - just extract bark mixture with several volumes of nonpolar solvent and pool

when_useful.acid_base_extractors: Probably unnecessary, especially if defatted before recovering freebase
when_useful.straight_to_base: Could be worth it - allows defatting
when_useful.mimosa_note: Many find Mimosa has little enough fat that defatting causes unnecessary product loss

process: Extract nonpolar DMT freebase solution with several volumes of water acidified to pH 3-4
Pool extracts
Optional: Defat acidic solution with couple volumes of nonpolar solvent
Basify to regenerate freebase
Extract with several volumes of extracting solvent
Pool extracts

optional_nonpolar_wash.purpose: Neutralize residual lye in nonpolar phase - BEST option for this concern
optional_nonpolar_wash.note: Many teks don't include this but it's highly recommended
process: Wash nonpolar freebase solution with small volume of dilute sodium carbonate (washing soda)
Target pH: ~8.5
Important: This is NOT baking soda (sodium bicarbonate)

technique.separation: Layers separate easily without emulsion - shake away
technique.drain: Drain water from bottom (assuming naphtha - organic layer on top)
technique.temperature: Use room temperature water to avoid cooling naphtha and encouraging precipitation
technique.optional_followup: Quick washes with neutral (unbasified) water to remove sodium carbonate traces

evaporation.recommendation: Still freeze-precipitate majority first before evaporating

process: Put nonpolar solvent in freezer (coldest setting)
Allow to sit overnight
DMT precipitates as nice crystals
Remove crystals - dry quickly or in cold environment (redissolve as solvent warms)
repeat_process: Reduce nonpolar solution to <half original volume
Repeat until no crystals or visible impurities in crystals
freeze_precipitation.final_step: Either discard remaining mess or evaporate and purify further
freeze_precipitation.crystal_growing_tip: Transfer recrystallizing solution back and forth between freezer and fridge every few hours for larger crystals

ammonia_wash.method: Wash Crystals with Cold Aqueous Ammonia
ammonia_wash.purpose: Simple way to wash out minor impurities and discoloration
ammonia_wash.process: Set up filtration, put crude DMT on filter, rinse with small volume ice-cold 10% aqueous ammonia
ammonia_wash.problem: Many people have ammonia dissolve away their product - difficult to recover

hot_solvent_recrystallization.benefits: Reduces impurities, gives sharper melting point
hot_solvent_recrystallization.limitation: Won't reduce discoloration much unless combined with activated charcoal
process: Dissolve product in minimal volume hot solvent (~20mL naphtha per gram DMT)
Allow solution to cool slowly with minimal agitation
Once at room temperature, transfer to fridge for couple hours
Then transfer to freezer
Optional: Add small DMT crystal to seed recrystallization
hot_solvent_recrystallization.result: Nice crop of crystals precipitates - collect by filtration
hot_solvent_recrystallization.if_unsatisfied: Reheat to redissolve, reduce volume, repeat cooling

activated_charcoal.effectiveness: MOST effective and reliable for removing discoloration
process: Dissolve DMT in hot solvent (as for recrystallization)
Add small quantity of crushed activated charcoal
Swirl occasionally, sustaining heat for ~10 minutes
Decant hot solvent from charcoal
Allow to crystallize as usual
activated_charcoal.note: Removes only discoloration impurities - requires fairly clean starting material
activated_charcoal.not_recommended: With crude nonpolar freebase solution prior to initial freeze-precipitation

acid_base_cleanup.use_case: Total overkill unless extraction was extremely messy
acid_base_cleanup.when_to_use: To recover DMT from gunk after evaporating solvent post-freeze-precipitation
process: Take crude material in water adjusted to pH 3-4 with chosen acid
Defat if desired
Basify, extract, and precipitate
acid_base_cleanup.alternative: If product is roughly crystalline, ammonia wash + recrystallization with charcoal should suffice

column_chromatography.audience: NOT for average extractor - requires chromatography column or buret
column_chromatography.when_needed: Analytic purity or godawful extraction goo needing heavy-duty purification
process: Plug stopcock end with glass wool (or cotton) filter
Cover with small portion of sand
Fill column with silica slurry
Load crude sample
Elute with chosen solvent pair
Monitor DMT progress with UV light
Capture correct fraction
column_chromatography.optional_prep: Run TLC first with same solvent pair
column_chromatography.note: If you don't understand this, you probably shouldn't attempt it

key_terminology.freebase: Non-salt form of DMT - not water soluble, soluble in nonpolar solvents
key_terminology.salt_form: Water soluble form of DMT (e.g., DMT acetate, DMT fumarate)
key_terminology.nonpolar_solvent: Solvents like naphtha, hexane, DCM - dissolve freebase DMT
key_terminology.defat: Remove plant fats/oils using nonpolar solvent on acidic solution
key_terminology.emulsion: Problematic mix of polar/nonpolar layers - avoid by gentle swirling not shaking
key_terminology.recrystallization: Purification by dissolving in hot solvent and allowing slow crystallization
key_terminology.freeze_precipitation: Causing crystals to form by cooling saturated solvent solution

common_problems_addressed.purity_issues: Often from following tek too closely without understanding pH targets
common_problems_addressed.harsh_product: Usually residual lye - use sodium carbonate wash (Vovin's method)
common_problems_addressed.gunk_instead_of_crystals: Use acid/base cleanup or column chromatography
